title: Flow Cytometry
steps:
1.  Inoculate single colony of freshly transformed DH5Pro or TOP10 cells in 4 ml LB medium containing
2. 50μg/ml chloramphenicol (or appropriate antibiotic).
3.  Grow the culture overnight at 37 C with shaking (250 rpm).
4.  Next day re-inoculate the cultures into 4 ml fresh LB medium having antibiotics and varying inducer
5. concentrations. Inducer concentrations can be varied from 0-1mM of IPTG or 0-200 ng/ml aTc.
6.  Collect the samples at different time intervals of 3, 6 and 9 hours.
7.  Monitor the growth rate by measuring optical density at 600 nm.
8.  Measure the fluorescence in a Becton Dickinson FACS Calibur flow cytometer equipped with a 488 nm argon
9. laser and a 515-545 nm emission filter (FL-1) and a 585-610 nm emission filter (FL-2).
10.  To measure the fluorescence, add 3-5 μl of the growing culture in ~1 ml PBS (phosphate buffer saline, pH-7.5).
11. Measurement should be done at low flow rate (~1000 events/second).
12.  For each sample, collect 50,000 events.
13.  Analyze the fluorescence in both FL-1 and FL-2 channel using FlowJo software (BD Biosciences).
14.  Determine the background fluorescence by using controls (cells having empty plasmid vector).
15.
